predator.name: predator
predator.description: A wide scissor stance with one foot forward and one back, knees bent low. The classic wizard skating power stance.
predator.notes: No open/closed stance variation. Can only appear as the first trick in a combo.

predator one.name: predator one
predator one.description: A one-footed predator stance, balancing on a single skate in the scissor position. Tests balance and core strength.
predator one.notes: No open/closed stance variation. Can only appear as the first trick in a combo.

parallel.name: parallel
parallel.description: Both feet side by side, rolling in parallel. A foundational position that sets up many transitions.
parallel.notes: Can only appear as the first trick in a combo.

tree.name: tree
tree.description: One foot is placed perpendicular to the other in a T-shape, creating a tree-like stance while rolling.

gazelle.name: gazelle
gazelle.description: A spinning crossover step that rotates the body 180 degrees while maintaining momentum. Elegant and flowing.
gazelle.notes: Rotating move: entry direction is opposite to exit direction. Has open/closed stance variations.

gazelle s.name: gazelle s
gazelle s.description: A sustained gazelle where the skater holds the crossed position longer before completing the rotation. The 's' stands for sustained.
gazelle s.notes: Non-rotating variant of gazelle. Has open/closed stance variations.

lion.name: lion
lion.description: A powerful rotational move where the skater pivots on the front wheels, swinging the body around 180 degrees.
lion.notes: Rotating move: entry direction is opposite to exit direction. Has open/closed stance variations.

lion s.name: lion s
lion s.description: A sustained lion where the pivot position is held longer. The 's' stands for sustained.
lion s.notes: Non-rotating variant of lion. Has open/closed stance variations.

toe press.name: toe press
toe press.description: Rolling on the toe wheels of both skates, pressing forward with the balls of the feet. Uses forward/fakie direction naming.
toe press.notes: Uses fakie/forward direction display. No stance variation.

heel press.name: heel press
heel press.description: Rolling on the heel wheels of both skates, leaning back with weight on the heels. Uses forward/fakie direction naming.
heel press.notes: Uses fakie/forward direction display. No stance variation.

toe roll.name: toe roll
toe roll.description: A continuous roll on toe wheels with a fluid, flowing motion. More dynamic than a toe press.
toe roll.notes: Uses fakie/forward direction display. No stance variation.

heel roll.name: heel roll
heel roll.description: A continuous roll on heel wheels with sustained balance and flow. More dynamic than a heel press.
heel roll.notes: Uses fakie/forward direction display. No stance variation.

360.description: A full 360-degree spin while rolling, completing one full rotation. A signature wizard skating move.
360.notes: Uses fakie/forward direction display. No stance variation.

180.description: A half spin (180 degrees) that reverses the skater's facing direction. Rotating move that changes exit direction.
180.notes: Rotating move: entry direction is opposite to exit direction. Uses fakie/forward direction display. No stance variation.

540.description: A one-and-a-half spin (540 degrees), combining a full rotation with an additional half turn. Highly technical.
540.notes: Rotating move: entry direction is opposite to exit direction. Uses fakie/forward direction display. No stance variation.

parallel slide.name: parallel slide
parallel slide.description: A powerslide with both feet parallel, sliding sideways to scrub speed. Uses forward/fakie direction naming.
parallel slide.notes: Uses fakie/forward direction display. No stance variation.

soul slide.name: soul slide
soul slide.description: A slide with one foot in soul position (sideways on the frame) and the other supporting. Classic aggressive skating influence.
soul slide.notes: Uses fakie/forward direction display. No stance variation.

acid slide.name: acid slide
acid slide.description: A slide variation where the lead foot is angled inward in an acid position. Stylish and technical.
acid slide.notes: Uses fakie/forward direction display. No stance variation.

mizu slide.name: mizu slide
mizu slide.description: A flowing slide named after water (mizu), characterized by a smooth, liquid-like sideways motion.
mizu slide.notes: Uses fakie/forward direction display. No stance variation.

star slide.name: star slide
star slide.description: A wide, star-shaped slide with legs spread apart. Visually impressive and requires good balance.
star slide.notes: Uses fakie/forward direction display. No stance variation.

fast slide.name: fast slide
fast slide.description: A quick, snappy slide performed at speed. Emphasizes quick execution over sustained hold.
fast slide.notes: Uses fakie/forward direction display. No stance variation.

back slide.name: back slide
back slide.description: A slide performed while moving backwards, with the skater sliding on the rear portion of the wheels.
back slide.notes: Uses fakie/forward direction display. No stance variation.

stunami.name: stunami
stunami.description: A powerful rotational move combining a spin with a wave-like body motion. Rotates the skater 180 degrees.
stunami.notes: Rotating move: entry direction is opposite to exit direction. Has open/closed stance variations.

ufo swivel.name: ufo swivel
ufo swivel.description: A swiveling rotation where the skater spins on both feet simultaneously, creating a UFO-like spinning motion. Rotates 180 degrees.
ufo swivel.notes: Rotating move: entry direction is opposite to exit direction. Has open/closed stance variations.

toe pivot.name: toe pivot
toe pivot.description: A pivot turn on the toe wheels, using the front of the skate as the rotation point.

heel pivot.name: heel pivot
heel pivot.description: A pivot turn on the heel wheels, using the back of the skate as the rotation point.
